cheese 0.0.2
  • Get started
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Select a subset of a list

pick.Rd
pick(
    list,
    ...
)

Arguments

list

Any list.
...

Selection of elements. See ?dplyr::select for details.

Value

A subset of the input list at the specified elements.

Examples


require(tidyverse)

list <-
  heart_disease %>%
  divide(
    Sex,
    HeartDisease,
    ChestPain
  )

length(list)
#> [1] 2

#Get Male sublist
list %>%
  pick(Male)
#> $Male
#> $Male$No
#> $Male$No$`Typical angina`
#> # A tibble: 12 x 6

#Get heart disease subset with each sex
list %>%
  map(
    pick,
    Yes
  )
#> $Female
#> $Female$Yes
#> $Female$Yes$`Atypical angina`

#Make same list with single depth
list2 <-
  heart_disease %>%
  divide(
    Sex,
    HeartDisease,
    ChestPain,
    depth = 1
  )

length(list2)
#> [1] 15

#Use select helpers
list2 %>%
  pick(
    matches("angina$")
  )
#> $`Female|No|Typical angina`
#> # A tibble: 4 x 6
#>     Age    BP Cholesterol BloodSugar MaximumHR ExerciseInducedAngina

#Multiple methods
list2 %>%
  pick(
    matches("angina$"),
    starts_with("Male")
  )
